definition: nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Helium is a monatomic chemically inert gas.
But the internal inertia against doing so appears too great at this time.
sentences.chinese: 但反對這種作爲的內部惰性這次似乎顯得太過強大了。

sentences.english: Both these moods leave you -- the ordinary citizen -- inert.
sentences.chinese: 這兩種情緒都讓作爲普通公民的你充滿惰性。

sentences.english: Inert gas arc weld the spring strut mount.
sentences.chinese: 惰性氣體電弧焊減震器支座。

sentences.english: Thermal inertia of small, rapidly warming.
So in the absence of this inert gas here, I just have the pure substance.
sentences.chinese: 如果沒有惰性氣體，我只有純物質。

sentences.english: And the answer is yes, we know something about the noble gases.
sentences.chinese: 答案是肯定的，我們對惰性氣體有所瞭解。

sentences.english: Nonmetal nanoclusters are generated by inert-gas condensation.
sentences.chinese: 採用惰性氣體凝聚法獲得非金屬團簇澱積體。

sentences.english: Non-impregnated steam activated carbon is inert and non-toxic.
sentences.chinese: 非蒸汽浸漬活性炭是惰性和無毒。

sentences.english: It is infeasible to directly deposit copper coating on carbon fiber of hydrophobic nature and inertia.
sentences.chinese: 碳纖維具有疏水性和表面惰性，很難直接鍍銅。

sentences.english: How can you overcome this inertia?
The results show that presintering temperature has the great effects on properties of inert anodes.
sentences.chinese: 研究結果表明，預燒溫度對惰性陽極的性能影響很大。

sentences.english: Non-violence is neither inert nor passive.
sentences.chinese: 非暴力並非惰性，也非被動。

sentences.english: Even thenonstriving person has the problem of inertia.
sentences.chinese: 即便不求上進的人也面臨惰性的問題。
所以，這一端有惰性元素。

sentences.english: In fact, inertia is the first to be conquered, so will the feelings of the.
sentences.chinese: 其實是人先被惰性徵服，所以感情纔會變淡的。

definition: to take things as they are (idiom)/to leave a situation as it is/to be happy with the status quo
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
brief period of enthusiasm/flash in the pan
(try to) overcome (hardships etc)/to conquer/to put up with/to endure
